name: Innisfree Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fantastic and offer everything you need and more! the host has clearly gone to alot of trouble to make this a beautiful hotel and is very friendly to all guests. the effort in the rooms continues onto breakfast which was gorgeous, we had full english both days we stayed as we could not resist! i would definitely return and recommend this B'n'B to anyone!
reviews.title: homely and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice hotel well decorated very clean room ,room was very cosy with excelent veiws , the owner was very friendly and couldnt do enough , the breakfast was excelent well worth having ,would return
reviews.title: vit1

reviews.text: Beautiful rooms. There are only 2 rooms, so if there are 3 or 4 of you, the entire upstairs is yours. The rooms are very well decorated, with good compliment tray, including chocs & biscuits. Free wi-fi. No guest lounge, although you can use Dining room. Excellent packed lunches supplied at small charge. Short walk to very nice pub (Miner's Arms) and Tea shops (not tried). Owner very friendly.
reviews.title: Very stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mum and dad had stayed here in august for a birthday and recommended it so we decided to try it, what a treat, stunning views, short walk to the village of Eyam, we stayed in the twin room as the double was booked,was superb clean modern and cottage style,fresh flowers and little extra's (chocolates&biscuits) The owners are very welcoming and informative.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B will go back

reviews.text: breakfast fantastic lots of choice, will definately be retuning and recommending.
reviews.title: Superb location in charming village

reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms at Innisfree cottage for a weekend stay. All emails prior to our visit were answered promptly and very efficiently and booking the accommodation was easy. Pauline was very welcoming and couldn't do enough to help us. The accommodation was superb-spotlessly clean, well equipped and extremely comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and the packed lunches we requested were wonderful. Could not find any fault with the whole experience and shall certainly be returning. Thank you Pauline!
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B!

reviews.text: A beautiful B&B in a very picturesque area. I stayed for 2 nights. My room was superb and the chocolates in my room on arrival just added to what was already a very friendly welcome. Breakfast was very tasty. Everywhere spotlessly clean. Free wi-fi!
reviews.title: Beautiful location, fantastic room

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights at the end of April while visiting family. Our room had an ensuite, and was very nicely decorated. The views from our room were lovely, and fresh cut flowers, chocolates and essentials to make tea in your room, only added to the comfort. Breakfasts were delicious, and you could have a fully cooked English breakfast, fruit, cereal, etc. Lovely properties surround this establishment, adding to the ambiance, and the main area of town is only minutes away by foot. Pauline, the owner, always very welcoming and friendly, made sure that you were well looked after. It was nice to have our own private entrance to come and go as we please, without disturbing others. We will stay here again when in Eyam!
reviews.title: "A Beautiful Property in a Picturesque Village"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely welcome and shown to a gorgeous room with ensuite. Views are to die for.
reviews.title: Cannot beat this

reviews.text: Breakfasts were delicious ,choice of cereals and fruit follwed with tea/coffee and a cooked breakfast.
reviews.title: Immaculate and Cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful views, impeccable and comfortable accommodation, delicious breakfast, helpful and friendly owners.
reviews.title: one of our all-time favorite b and b's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to book online, great location in sleepy picturesque village of Eyam, great pub 10 mins down the road with really good food and beer garden. Innisfree Cottage was in a lovely, quiet road with great views. The welcome from the owner was relaxed and friendly and just right. We stayed in the double room which was lovely - all of the communal areas are so nicely done out and clean. Room was clean, spacious, fresh, airy and the bed was really comfy. Breakfast also great - lots of choice and really fresh. A really good stay.
reviews.title: Great place - would definitely go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Immaculately presented accomodation. Very comfy beds,great breakfasts and a welcoming and helpful owner. Also superb location in lovely Eyam. Recommend highly.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: I stayed at Innisfree Cottage in May 2011 as I was working in the area and required overnight accomodation. I already knew that the B&B has been recently converted, but when I arrived I was stunned by the quality of the finishes in the entrance, bedroom and en-suite. The owners have clearly spent a lot of time designing and furnishing these rooms which were spotlessly clean and of a high standard of finish.
reviews.title: Newly built/refurbished B&B with stunning views and unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the beautifully decorated room there were lots of nice touches, big soft fluffly towells, stocked tea tray with home made cookies and chocolates, flat screen tv, lovely en suite shower room. The bed was so amazingly comfy I had one of the best nights sleep in a long time. The view from the window of the double room is out over the valley as the B&B is set up on a hill and it is quite stunning.
reviews.title: Fantasic B&B - beautiful views, lovely rooms, really friendly owners

description: Innisfree Cottage is tucked away on a pretty country lane in the village of Eyam. The cottage has been converted in 2010 to accommodate four guests in two newly renovated rooms on the first floor. There are two guest rooms at Innisfree Cottage both situated on the first floor. The twin room has a private bathroom with bath and shower and white robes are available for guests. There is a flat screen television and DVD in addition to a radio and CD player in each room. There are numerous DVDs and books available to use during your stay. There are tea and coffee making facilities in each room in addition to a hair dryer.Individually controlled central heating radiators ensure that the heating is suitable for all guests. An ironing board is available on request. The double room has an en-suite with shower. The room overlooks the garden and has stunning views towards Bretton.
